00021 Recognizer::Recognizer (const std::string &path) : texts_(std::vector<Text>(0)), statistics_(std::vector<Statistics>(0))
00022 {
00023     // Load image from disk
00024     std::vector<Magick::Image> images;
00025     Magick::readImages( &images, path );
00026     
00027     Magick::Image image = images[0];
00028     
00029     // Store the image dimensions
00030     width_  = image.columns();
00031     height_ = image.rows();
00032     
00033     // Load image into the internal vector
00034     loadImage(image);
00035 };

00057 void Recognizer::obtainText ()
00058 {
00059     obtainText(0, 0, height_, width_);
00060 };

00082 void Recognizer::obtainText (const unsigned int &x, const unsigned int &y, unsigned int &height, unsigned int &width)
00083 {
00084     // Test the upper left-most pixel X coordinate is inside the source image
00085     if ( (x >= height_) or (x < 0) )
00086         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The x coordinate of the clip's top left-most pixel is outside the image");
00087         
00088     // Test the upper left-most pixel Y coordinate is inside the source image
00089     if ( (y >= width_) or (y < 0) )
00090         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The y coordinate of the clip's top left-most pixel is outside the image");
00091     
00092     // Test the clip's height is not bigger than the image
00093     if ( (height > height_) or (height < 0) )
00094         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The height of the clip is bigger than the image's height or less than 0");
00095         
00096     // Test the clip's width is not bigger than the image
00097     if ( (width > width_) or (width < 0) )
00098         throw NessieException ("Recognizer::obtainText() : The width of the clip is bigger than the image's width or less than 0");
00099         
00100     // Truncate the clip's height if it is outside the source image
00101     if ((x + height) > height_)
00102         height = height_ - x;
00103     
00104     // Truncate the clip's width if it is outside the source image
00105     if ((y + width) > width_)
00106         width = width_ - y;
00107     
00108     // Creates the clip
00109     Clip clip(image_, x, y, height, width);
00110     
00111     
00112     // Preprocessing stage
00113     Preprocessor preprocessor;
00114     preprocessor.computeOptimalThreshold(clip);
00115     preprocessor.removeIsolatedNoise(clip);
00116     updateImage(clip);
00117     
00118     
00119     // Segmentation stage
00120     
00121     
00122     // Classification stage
00123 };

00129 void Recognizer::writeExternalImage (Magick::Image &externalImage) const
00130 {
00131     unsigned int rows = height_, columns = width_;
00132     
00133     // Test if the image is empty to create a new one
00134     if ( (externalImage.rows() == 0) and (externalImage.columns() == 0) )
00135         externalImage = Magick::Image(Magick::Geometry(width_, height_), "white");
00136     
00137     // Test if the external image fits into the current image
00138     if ( externalImage.rows() < height_ )
00139         rows = externalImage.rows();
00140     
00141     if ( externalImage.columns() < width_ )
00142         columns = externalImage.columns();
00143     
00144     // Convert the image into a grayscale colorspace
00145     externalImage.type( Magick::GrayscaleType );
00146     
00147     // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image
00148     // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00149     externalImage.modifyImage();
00150         
00151     // Copy the current data into the external image
00152     for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < rows; ++i )
00153     {
00154         for ( unsigned int j = 0; j < columns; ++j )
00155         {
00156             unsigned int index = (i * columns) + j;
00157             
00158             Magick::ColorGray color;
00159             color.shade(static_cast<double>(image_[index]) / 255.0);
00160             externalImage.pixelColor(j, i, color);
00161         }
00162     }
00163     
00164     // Save changes to image.
00165     externalImage.syncPixels();
00166 };

00173 void Recognizer::loadImage (Magick::Image &image)
00174 {
00175     // Convert the image into grayscale colorspace
00176     image.type( Magick::GrayscaleType );
00177     
00178     // Ensure that there is only one reference to underlying image
00179     // If this is not done, then image pixels will not be modified.
00180     image.modifyImage();
00181     
00182     // Copy the image into the internal data structure
00183     image_.reserve(height_ * width_);
00184     for ( unsigned int i = 0; i < height_; ++i )
00185     {
00186         for ( unsigned int j = 0; j < width_; ++j )
00187         {
00188             Magick::ColorGray grayLevel = image.pixelColor(j, i);
00189             
00190             image_.push_back( static_cast<unsigned char>(round(grayLevel.shade() * 255.0)) );
00191         }
00192     }   
00193 };

00195 
00200 void Recognizer::updateImage (const Clip &clip)
00201 {
00202     // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00203     std::vector<unsigned char> pixels = clip.pixels();
00204     std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator = pixels.begin();
00205     
00206     for ( unsigned int i = clip.x(); i < clip.height(); ++i )
00207     {
00208         for ( unsigned int j = clip.y(); j < clip.width(); ++j )
00209             image_[(i * width_) + j] = *pixelsIterator++;
00210     }
00211 };
